intro: Dodecatheon jeffreyi var. typica, commonly known as Jeffrey's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. This species is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes.
